context:
In case of a reported weapon on campus grounds, students, faculty, staff, and visitors are advised to follow the instructions of Campus Security, Public Safety and Security Division, or Emergency Services personnel. Faculty and staff should treat the situation as an Active Threat, help students move to a secure location, report the incident to Campus Security (416-415-4000 or "0" from any George Brown College internal phone), and dial 911 if safe to do so. Secure classroom and office doors, keep away from windows, and turn off lights. Faculty/staff are not to investigate further but should take direction only from a police officer, Campus Security officer, or a member of the Public Safety and Security Division. If aware of a reported weapon but not an immediate threat, notify Campus Security immediately and remain with the person who reported it. Contact information for George Brown College: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca.

Entities: Campus Security, Public Safety and Security Division, Emergency Services personnel, Faculty, Staff, Students, Visitors, George Brown College (phone numbers: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca)
